Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sapling activates dec 15th, sprout is made illegal after feb 15th

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_ACTIVATION 1544832000 // Dec 15th, 2018
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_DEADLINE 1550188800 // Feb 15th, 2019

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ahh ok cool.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So what it does is wait until that timestamp and then choose a block height +X and set that as hte height ?

Author: CMaurice#1685
Content: coincidentally just started a build of StakedChain/komodo a few mins ago, will update notary now

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just I noticed that when testing hte pool.. it dint activate at the exact time stamp I set it to .. .sometimes up to 10-15mins later (I had the second timestamp set at that)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r not exactly... it is a bit more complex to get consensus safe values for activation height, the code is in komodo_activate_sapling() in main.cpp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the deadline, i just check the timestamp of chaintip to see if it is legal or not

Author: gt#2812
Content: building

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if we end up with some out of order timestamps near the deadline it isnt any big issue to have sprout illegal, then legal, then illegal again

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ok cool.. yes I guess your dealing with block heights for this... its not like notarisaions where just having a gap is enough, as they are not exactly a consensuse change/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sapling activation MUST be the identical height for all nodes, during the transition, during resync, etc. and it can only be done once

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is why most activations have a hard coded height

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with the zillion chains, i was too lazy to make different heights in a table to handle all chains, plus if we had any large cluster, it would be totally impractical

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not that doing it for dozens of chains is practical and not error prone as it is

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yeah that sounds like abad way to do it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: therefore -> komodo_activate_sapling()

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: took a few iterations to get it performant and accurate

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
as long as all nodes in a chain choose the same height then its fine. 
I am a bit confused as to why migrates broke BEFORE saplingactivated though ... I hope I can track this down... its not sapling related as it hasnt even chosen its height yet.
